name: Srikanta Bedathur
content: Srikanta Bedathur Search Srikanta Bedathur DS Chair of Artificial Intelligence IIT Delhi I am a professor and DS Chair Professor of Artificial Intelligence at the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at IIT Delhi. I hold a joint appointment with the YScAI - Yardi School of Artificial Intelligence and currently head the Amar Nath and Shashi Khosla School of Information Technology. I have previously worked as a research scientist at IBM Research as part of their AI Research team, as a faculty member at IIIT Delhi, and senior researcher at the Max-Planck Institute for Informatics (MPII) with Gerhard Weikum. My PhD (2005) was from the Indian Institute of Science where I worked with Jayant Haritsa. Interests Temporal Information Modeling Graph Data Mining and Management Information Retrieval Knowledge-bases - infrastructure, modelling and practical usage Data wrangling - data integration, relationship discovery and visualization Education PhD, 1998-2005 IISc BE, 1991-1995 Bangalore University Recent Posts More Posts Vinayak Gupta Apr 23, 2023 Vinayak Graduates! Vinayak graduated with flying colors! His thesis was highly rated by all reviewers who gave it an ``award quality”. He (remotely) defended the thesis from U Washington where he is doing his post-doc with Tim Althoff. CONTINUE READING Vinayak Gupta , Shubham Gupta , Sahil Manchanda , Abir De , Sayan Ranu , Srikanta Bedathur Dec 2, 2021 Two Papers Accepted in AAAI 2022! After waiting what seemed like an eternity (it was just 2 days due to delayed notifications), we got acceptance notifications for both of our submissions. Work led by wonderful Ph.D. students, Vinayak Gupta and Shubham Gupta!! CONTINUE READING Srikanta Bedathur Last updated on Oct 18, 2021 Congratulations Dr. Garima Gaur! Garima Gaur, my second Ph.D. student, advised jointly with Arnab Bhattacharya at IITK, successfully defended her thesis titled Provenance-Aware Computation and Maintenance of Graph Query Results under Dynamic Knowledge Graphs. Congratulations, Dr. Gaur! CONTINUE READING On Summer/Winter Internship Requests I am NOT offering any short-term projects for internships and I do not have the bandwidth to respond to requests about summer or winter internships. If you are interested in working with me, I recommend you apply for a short-term employment in one of my projects, or join the B.Tech./M.Tech./Ph.D. programs in IIT-Delhi.
